data.chText: （使）变淡，变暗
data.enText: to become or to make sth become paler or less bright

data.chText: 天上的颜色都退去了。
data.enText: All colour had faded from the sky.

data.chText: 窗帘已经给晒退了色。
data.enText: The curtains had faded in the sun.

data.chText: 太阳把窗帘晒退了色。
data.enText: The sun had faded the curtains.

data.chText: 他穿着退色的蓝牛仔裤。
data.enText: He was wearing faded blue jeans.

data.chText: 逐渐消逝；逐渐消失
data.enText: to disappear gradually

data.chText: 她的笑容逐渐消失。
data.enText: Her smile faded.

data.chText: 达成协议的希望看来已逐渐渺茫。
data.enText: Hopes of reaching an agreement seem to be fading away.

data.chText: 他的声音越来越小，变成了耳语。
data.enText: His voice faded to a whisper (= gradually became quieter) .

data.chText: 笑声逐渐消逝。
data.enText: The laughter faded away.

data.chText: 与挣扎求存相比，所有其他问题都显得不重要了。
data.enText: All other issues fade into insignificance compared with the struggle for survival.

data.chText: （运动员、运动队、演员等）走下坡路，衰退，衰落
data.enText: if a sports player, team, actor, etc. fades , they stop playing or performing as well as they did before

data.chText: 布莱克在最后一个弯道处速度慢了下来。
data.enText: Black faded on the final bend.
blend/fade into the woodwork

data.chText: 默默无闻；销声匿迹；蛰伏
data.enText: to behave in a way that does not attract any attention; to disappear or hide
fade away

data.chText: 衰弱；病重死亡
data.enText: to become very weak or ill/sick and die

data.chText: 她在生命的最后几个星期已是草枯灯油尽了。
data.enText: In the last weeks of her life she simply faded away.
fade in/out

data.chText: （画面）淡入 / 淡出，渐显 / 渐隐；（声音）渐强 / 渐弱
data.enText: to become clearer or louder / less clear or quieter

data.chText: 乔治看见屏幕变暗，接着出现了几个字。
data.enText: George saw the monitor black out and then a few words faded in.
fade sth in/out

data.chText: 使（画面）淡入 / 淡出；使渐显 / 渐隐；使（声音）渐强 / 渐弱
data.enText: to make a picture or a sound clearer or louder / less clear or quieter

data.chText: 在这个场景的末尾把音乐减弱。
data.enText: Fade out the music at the end of the scene.

means: (运动员、运动队、演员等)走下坡路，衰退，衰落

ex.chText: 太阳把蓝色桌布晒掉色了。
ex.enText: The sun faded the blue-coloured tablecloth.

ex.chText: 这个牌子的牛仔裤不会褪色。
ex.enText: This brand of jeans will not fade.

synonyms.bx: 指（使）某物失去颜色和光泽。

ex.chText: 他因常年辛苦工作而白发苍苍。
ex.enText: Years of toil blanched his hair.

ex.chText: 这种材料在阳光照射下会变白。
ex.enText: This material blanches in the sun.

synonyms.bx: 指（使）某人因害怕或震惊而变得面色苍白或（使）某物变白。

ex.chText: 我怎样才能在家美白牙齿呢？
ex.enText: How can I bleach my teeth at home?

ex.chText: 大衣被太阳晒得褪了色。
ex.enText: The coat was bleached by the sun.

synonyms.bx: 指通过日照或使用化学品使某物颜色变淡或变白。

ex.chText: 太阳逐渐把窗帘晒褪色了。
ex.enText: The sun discoloured the curtain day by day.

ex.chText: 这个苹果是昨天切开的，现在已经变色了。
ex.enText: The apple was cut yesterday and it is already discoloured.

synonyms.bx: 指（使）某物变色，通常变得比以前难看。

ex.chText: 比赛结果出来之后，她的脸色明显变白了。
ex.enText: She visibly whitened when the game result was released.

ex.chText: 大雪为整片森林披上了银装。
我怎样才能漂白我的衬衫呢？
ex.enText: How can I whiten my blouse?

synonyms.bx: 指（使）某人的脸色或某物变白或在原来的基础上变得更白。

data.enText: blend/fade into the woodwork

data.chText: 默默无闻；销声匿迹；蛰伏
data.enText: to behave in a way that does not attract any attention; to disappear or hide
fade away

data.chText: 衰弱；病重死亡
data.enText: to become very weak or ill/sick and die

data.chText: 她在生命的最后几个星期已是草枯灯油尽了。
data.enText: In the last weeks of her life she simply faded away.
fade in/out

data.chText: （画面）淡入 / 淡出，渐显 / 渐隐；（声音）渐强 / 渐弱
data.enText: to become clearer or louder / less clear or quieter

data.chText: 乔治看见屏幕变暗，接着出现了几个字。
data.enText: George saw the monitor black out and then a few words faded in.
fade sth in/out

data.chText: 使（画面）淡入 / 淡出；使渐显 / 渐隐；使（声音）渐强 / 渐弱
data.enText: to make a picture or a sound clearer or louder / less clear or quieter

data.chText: 在这个场景的末尾把音乐减弱。
data.enText: Fade out the music at the end of the scene.

trans: （所视之物）逐渐变暗，逐渐模糊看不见
渐渐淡出人们视线；渐渐变得籍籍无名
（光）渐暗；（画面）淡出，渐隐；（声音）渐弱

tr: a golf shot that curves to the right for a right-handed golfer
example: he took lessons to cure his slicing
The prisoner has be languishing for years in the dungeon

tr: become less clearly visible or distinguishable
example: The tree trunks are melting into the forest at dusk

value.def: When a coloured object fades or when the light fades it, it gradually becomes paler.

example.ex: All colour fades — especially under the impact of direct sunlight...
example.tran: 所有颜色都会褪色——尤其是在阳光直射下。

example.ex: No matter how soft the light is, it still plays havoc, fading carpets and curtains in every room.
example.tran: 无论多么柔和的光线，也仍然会造成损害，会让所有房间的地毯和窗帘褪色。

example.ex: ...fading portraits of the Queen and Prince Philip.
example.tran: 女王和菲利普亲王的褪色的画像

example.ex: ...faded painted signs on the sides of some of the buildings.
example.tran: 一些建筑物侧面褪了色的油漆标记

value.def: When light fades, it slowly becomes less bright. When a sound fades, it slowly becomes less loud.

example.ex: Seaton lay on his bed and gazed at the ceiling as the light faded...
example.tran: 光线渐渐暗了下去，西顿躺在床上，凝视着天花板。

example.ex: The sound of the last bomber's engines faded into the distance.
example.tran: 最后一架轰炸机的引擎声渐渐消失在远方。

value.tran: (光线)逐渐暗淡;(声音)逐渐减弱

value.def: When something that you are looking at fades, it slowly becomes less bright or clear until it disappears.

example.ex: They observed the comet for 70 days before it faded from sight...
example.tran: 他们观察了这颗彗星 70 天，直至其慢慢从视线中消失。

example.ex: They watched the familiar mountains fade into the darkness.
example.tran: 他们看着熟悉的群山渐渐隐没到黑夜当中。

example.ex: We watched the harbour and then the coastline fade away into the morning mist.
example.tran: 我们凝望着港口，只见海岸线渐渐隐于晨雾之中。

value.tran: (所注视之物)逐渐暗淡，逐渐模糊直至消失

value.def: If someone or something fades, for example, into the background, they become hardly noticeable or very unimportant.

example.ex: She had a way of fading into the background when things got rough...
example.tran: 情况一有不妙，她总能退到幕后。

example.ex: The most prominent poets of the Victorian period had all but faded from the scene.
example.tran: 维多利亚时期最显赫的诗人差不多已全部湮没无声了。

example.ex: The sound comes up and slowly fades away into the distance.
example.tran: 声音响起来，又慢慢消失在远处。

value.tran: 变得不为人注意;变得无关紧要

value.def: If memories, feelings, or possibilities fade, they slowly become less intense or less strong.

example.ex: Sympathy for the rebels, the government claims, is beginning to fade...
example.tran: 政府宣称，对叛乱分子的同情开始消退。

example.ex: Prospects for peace had already started to fade.
example.tran: 和平的前景已经开始日渐暗淡。
对美好时光的日渐模糊的记忆

value.tran: (记忆)逐渐模糊;(感情)逐渐变淡;(可能性)逐渐变小

value.def: If someone's smile fades, they slowly stop smiling.

example.tran: 杰伊点点头，笑容慢慢隐去了。

value.def: When something fades out, it slowly becomes less noticeable or less important until it disappears completely.

example.ex: He thought her campaign would probably fade out soon in any case.
example.tran: 他认为不管怎样，她的竞选活动都可能会很快归于沉寂。

value.tran: 淡出;变得不再引人注目(直至完全消失)

value.def: When light, an image, or a sound fades out, it disappears after gradually becoming weaker.

example.ex: You'll need to be able to project two images onto the screen as the new one fades in and the old image fades out.
example.tran: 你得能将两个图像投射到屏幕上，让新的渐渐淡入，旧的渐渐淡出。

value.tran: (光线)逐渐暗淡;(画面)淡出; (声音)渐弱
